posts.title: Cinemascope Trilogy (1997 – 2001)
posts.excerpt: _L’Arrivée_ L’Arrivée is Tscherkassky’s second hommage to the Lumiére-brothers. First you see the arrival of the film itself, which shows the arrival of a train at a station. But that train collides with a second train, causing a violent crash, which leads us to an unexpected third arrival, the arrival of a beautiful woman – …

posts.excerpt: Quote: Song of revolutionary hero, Valentin, sung by Jose Santollo Nasido en Santa Cruz de la Soledad; Chapala, Jalisco, Mexico.

posts.title: Kompani Orheim
posts.excerpt: Jarle Klepp gets a message that forces his mind back to something he’d rather forgotten – his childhood with his father in Stavanger. When “Orheim” was his surname.

posts._title: Fei Xie – Ben ming nian AKA Black Snow (1990)
posts.title: Ben ming nian
posts.excerpt: A semi-literate who was deprived of schooling during the Cultural Revolution, Li Huiquan, is released from labor camp. But his attempts to make good are continually thwarted. His street stall selling clothes puts him on the fringe of the black market, and he soon gets lured back into his old neighbourhood gangs. His disenchanted comrades …

posts._title: Hans Richter & Jean Cocteau – 8 X 8: A Chess Sonata in 8 Movements (1957)
posts.title: 8 X 8: A Chess Sonata in 8 Movements
posts.excerpt: Quote: A masterpiece of experimental film and a projection of the surrealist vision into cinema by its outstanding artists. Described by Richter as “part Freud, part Lewis Carroll,” it is a fairy tale for the subconscious based on the game of chess. This chess-sonata is played by a host of artists including Paul Bowles, Jean …

posts.title: Rape
posts.excerpt: “This beautiful example of far-fetched blasphemy accompanies a happy, ugly nun into the woods for her constitutional, replete with charming bird noises. Praying to and fondling a priapic mushroom, she is unaware of the evil rapist shadowing her. When the rape occurs, it is in long shot, hidden from view, under a huge tree. Articles …

posts.title: Animated Soviet Propaganda (1924 – 1984)
posts.excerpt: CONTENTS: DISC 1: AMERICAN IMPERIALISTS BLACK AND WHITE (1933) Whenever the collection criticizes American racism, its credibility goes way up. We start with this shocking, graphic exaggeration (?) of America as a land where slavery still rules. MISTER TWISTER (1963) This poem-based tale uses cute animation to tell the story of a racist American who …
